name: Ribeye
description: Rich marbling, intense flavor with exceptional tenderness. The king of steaks with buttery texture and robust beef taste.
cookingNotes: Best grilled or pan-seared over high heat. Cook to medium-rare (130-135Â°F) to preserve the marbling and tenderness. Let rest 5 minutes before serving.

name: Filet Mignon
description: Tender, buttery texture with mild flavor. The most tender cut available with unparalleled softness.
cookingNotes: Perfect for pan-searing or grilling. Cook to medium-rare (130-135Â°F). Avoid overcooking to maintain the delicate texture. Pairs well with rich sauces.

name: NY Strip
description: Perfect balance of tenderness and flavor. A classic steakhouse cut with excellent marbling and firm texture.
cookingNotes: Excellent grilled or broiled. Cook to medium-rare to medium (135-145Â°F). The fat cap should be left on during cooking for added flavor.

name: Porterhouse
description: Best of both worlds - combines filet mignon and NY strip in one impressive cut. Perfect for sharing.
cookingNotes: Grill or broil over medium-high heat. The filet side cooks faster, so position accordingly. Cook to medium-rare (130-135Â°F) for optimal results.

name: Tomahawk
description: Impressive presentation cut with long bone intact. A showstopper ribeye with dramatic visual appeal.
cookingNotes: Reverse sear method recommended. Start in low oven (275Â°F) then finish with high-heat sear. Allow extra resting time due to size.

name: Brisket
description: Perfect for slow cooking with incredible depth of flavor when properly prepared. A barbecue favorite.
cookingNotes: Low and slow cooking required. Smoke at 225Â°F for 12-16 hours or braise in oven at 275Â°F. Internal temp should reach 195-205Â°F for tenderness.

name: Ground Wagyu
description: Premium ground beef with exceptional flavor and juiciness. Perfect for gourmet burgers and meatballs.
cookingNotes: Handle gently to maintain texture. Cook to 135Â°F for medium-rare burgers. The high fat content makes it incredibly juicy - avoid overcooking.

name: Short Ribs
description: Rich, flavorful bones perfect for braising. Incredible marbling creates fall-off-the-bone tenderness when slow cooked.
cookingNotes: Braise at 325Â°F for 2-3 hours until fork tender. Can also be smoked low and slow. The connective tissue breaks down into rich gelatin.
